Line 35: Line 35:
'''Disney Channel''' is a children's entertainment channel available in the [[United Kingdom]] and the [[Republic of Ireland]] since 1 October 1995. A 1 hour [[timeshift channel|timeshift]] service called '''Disney Channel +1''' is available on [[Sky (UK & Ireland)|Sky]] and [[Virgin Media]]. Disney Channel currently has three sister channels; [[Disney Cinemagic (UK & Ireland)|Disney Cinemagic]], [[Playhouse Disney (UK & Ireland)|Playhouse Disney]] and [[Disney XD (UK & Ireland)|Disney XD]].
'''Disney Channel''' is a children's entertainment channel available in the [[United Kingdom]] and the [[Republic of Ireland]] since 1 October 1995. A 1 hour [[timeshift channel|timeshift]] service called '''Disney Channel +1''' is available on [[Sky (UK & Ireland)|Sky]] and [[Virgin Media]]. Disney Channel currently has three sister channels; [[Disney Cinemagic (UK & Ireland)|Disney Cinemagic]], [[Playhouse Disney (UK & Ireland)|Playhouse Disney]] and [[Disney XD (UK & Ireland)|Disney XD]].
â
'''Updatbupdate update '''http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/User:MJF2000/Articles_for_creation/Disney_Channel_(UK_%26_Ireland)_Events_2011#Upcoming_Events_with_no_date_announced
 
==Overview==
==Overview==
Neither the Disney Channel nor its sister channels (with the exception of [[Disney XD (UK & Ireland)|Disney XD]]) broadcast commercial advertisements, relying instead on revenue from the subscription fees that the viewer must pay. Despite the lack of commercials, most non-movie programming is broken up by non-commercial breaks, during which trailers for Disney's programming and specially-commissioned short programmes (e.g. ''Disney 365'') are usually shown. Disney Channel has now, however, undertaken its first ever commercial [[sponsorship]] of a programme; [[Wizards of Waverly Place]] is sponsored by [[Asda]]-owned clothing brand 'George'.
Neither the Disney Channel nor its sister channels (with the exception of [[Disney XD (UK & Ireland)|Disney XD]]) broadcast commercial advertisements, relying instead on revenue from the subscription fees that the viewer must pay. Despite the lack of commercials, most non-movie programming is broken up by non-commercial breaks, during which trailers for Disney's programming and specially-commissioned short programmes (e.g. ''Disney 365'') are usually shown. Disney Channel has now, however, undertaken its first ever commercial [[sponsorship]] of a programme; [[Wizards of Waverly Place]] is sponsored by [[Asda]]-owned clothing brand 'George'.

The interactive service also includes links to a small selection of games. Some can be played as 'overlay' games, with the channel video continuing in the background; others are accessible via a link to a Disney-branded section of BSkyB's ''[[Sky Games]]'' interactive service. The overlay games are developed by [[Pushbutton]] and French game developers [[Visiware]].
The interactive service also includes links to a small selection of games. Some can be played as 'overlay' games, with the channel video continuing in the background; others are accessible via a link to a Disney-branded section of BSkyB's ''[[Sky Games]]'' interactive service. The overlay games are developed by [[Pushbutton]] and French game developers [[Visiware]].
Line 50: Line 49:
Disney Channel was originally planned to launch in 1989 on the newly launched [[Sky Television plc|Sky]] satellite service. It was featured in much of the promotional material surrounding the launch of Sky Television and the Astra satellite. Due to an apparent dispute, the launch was cancelled. Sky Television filed a lawsuit against the Walt Disney Company for not launching the channel.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://ftp.funet.fi/pub/dx/text/NEWS/SCDX/scdx2043.txt|title=Number 2043|publisher=SWEDEN CALLING DXERS|date=May 16, 1989}}</ref>
Disney Channel was originally planned to launch in 1989 on the newly launched [[Sky Television plc|Sky]] satellite service. It was featured in much of the promotional material surrounding the launch of Sky Television and the Astra satellite. Due to an apparent dispute, the launch was cancelled. Sky Television filed a lawsuit against the Walt Disney Company for not launching the channel.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://ftp.funet.fi/pub/dx/text/NEWS/SCDX/scdx2043.txt|title=Number 2043|publisher=SWEDEN CALLING DXERS|date=May 16, 1989}}</ref>

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/User:MJF2000/Articles_for_creation/Disney_Channel_(UK_%26_Ireland)_Events_2011#Upcoming_Events_with_no_date_announced
 
The channel appeared on 1 October 1995. At first the channel's broadcasting hours were 06:00 to 22:00 with [[Sky Movies Gold]] airing during the station's downtime. The launch of [[Sky Digital|Sky]] in 1998 saw the channel increase its broadcasting hours for digital satellite viewers.
The channel appeared on 1 October 1995. At first the channel's broadcasting hours were 06:00 to 22:00 with [[Sky Movies Gold]] airing during the station's downtime. The launch of [[Sky Digital|Sky]] in 1998 saw the channel increase its broadcasting hours for digital satellite viewers.
